Zombies is, in my opinion, the best part of Black Ops 7. Treyarch has addressed most of the shortcomings of last year's zombies. This includes removing special/elite enemy spam, adding actual atmosphere, rebalancing some augments, buffing weapons, and bringing back the classic points system in cursed mode. Ashes of the Damned is a great launch map and I'm excited for what's next. That being said, zombies is pretty similar to last year and feels like what Black Ops 6 should have been. Zombies is an 8/10 and the overall game is a 7/10. I do recommend the game if you're a die hard COD/Black Ops fan, especially for zombies, but I'd recommend buying on sale.

Call of Duty Black Ops 7 is probably the most disappointed I've been in a COD game. I'm going to split this review into sections so that it's easier to read.

Campaign

Let me keep this short. This is the worst campaign since BO3. The story focuses to much on the Cradle to create psychedelic experiences. This is the majority of the campaign. 

SPOLIER WARNING HERE! 

It disrespects BOII, and de-canonizes parts of it. For those who may not remember, either Harper or Karma has to die. If you save Harper in BOII, Farid is killed, thus Karma is killed by Salazar. If you kill Harper, Karma is saved because Farid takes the hit for her. So what I want to know is, how are they both alive. There's missions referencing BOII, and there are constant call backs to it, but this plot hole is not ok. The only way I can make sense of it, is that the bullet that hits Karma didn't actually kill her, and she survived, that's all I got, and I feel like I'm grasping at straws.

SPOLIER OVER!

Another issue with campaign is that it's co-op only, and if you try to play alone, your character will be there, but your squad mates will not. Your squad mates will still talk to you, but they're nowhere to be seen if you play alone. This goes for co-op too, if you don't have four people in a lobby, a character will be missing, but will appear in cutscenes, and speak as if they are actually there. This is extremely jarring to say the least. The only good thing to come out of the campaign this year is the cross weapon progression, that's really it. I didn't care for Endgame as it's just not for me. Overall, Campaign is a complete waste of time.

Multiplayer

Multiplayer is fun for the most part, but I can't help feeling some of the changes made negatively impact the experience. Auto Aim has been so nerfed it can be hard to line up shots a lot of the time (This is getting buffed in the season 1 update). Right now though I feel like controller is at a major disadvantage. I do agree that Aim Assist is the weakest it's been in the franchise, which means that as always, keyboard and mouse have a major advantage. Did it need a nerf last year, sure I can't argue that, but this was way to much. Another issue is the matchmaking. I get people are excited that it's open now, but for me this has really hurt my experience. As a person with low vision and CP, my reaction and reflexes are slower, SBMM helped in this area because I could play with those who were of similar skill level, allowing me to contribute to my team. Before anyone says it in the comments, yes there is a standard matchmaking option, but it's clear it's going to be secondary to open matchmaking. More specifically they just added the Nuketown playlist to open, but standard is still just core moshpit. This is an issue because while Nuketown will appear in the map rotation, it isn't a playlist we can select in standard matchmaking. This means that anyone who wants SBMM for a more even playing field won't get it. For me personally, that means I won't be able to help my team and that just hurts. I'm glad both playlists are there, but standard needs love too. Why can't Nuketown 24/7 be in both playlists? It just doesn't make sense to me. I also am not really enjoying the weapon camo grind. Getting to prestige master for me hasn't been the best experience, partly because of what I mentioned above. I know this could change with some updates, but right now I can't say I've enjoyed the multiplayer to it's fullest, physically because I can't.

Zombies

I'm not much of a zombies player anymore, but I'm glad survival is back. I fell in love with zombies because it was about getting to as high of a round as you could. I don't enjoy the standard, or even directed mode. I miss the days where it was just kill zombies. What I will say though is the power situation in solo play is not great. If you play solo you have to shoot the skulls to destroy them, then you can turn on the power. I find this to not be very fun, and I feel it just adds needless filler to what your trying to do. It's fine in a group, but for solo it really has got to go. I do enjoy the map however as it does remind me of farm from BOII. That's all I really have to say on zombies. Like i said not much of a zombies player anymore.

Conclusion

BO7 has a lot of fun ideas. It's great to see BO2 characters again like David and Harper. The campaign is completely not worth anything, I believe it shouldn't even be cannon, it makes no sense, and the forced co-op takes away from what a campaign is. It could be remedied by allowing us to play with bots, but who knows if that will happen. Not to mention needing to always be online is just not ok.

Multiplayer is fun, but them not updating the standard playlist saddens me. I'm glad it's open for those who want it open, but I feel like people like me are going to struggle this year because of factors out of our control. I don't write about my disabilities for pity, but I want to stress the point that SBMM helped me play too. I know standard exists, but it's clear it won't be getting the new playlists like open will. (Hope I'm wrong on this in the future).

Zombies is fun, but I feel some changes need to be made for it to be more enjoyable across the board. (Zombies is also getting some changes in the season 1 update).

There's my thoughts on the game as a whole.
